alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 9:48AM EDT until June 20 at 11:45AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Eastern Franklin County in west central Virginia. * WHEN...Until 100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 947 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Coles Creek, Dillons Mill Branch, Crab Creek, Blackwater River, Dinner Creek, Beaver Creek, Big Chestnut Creek, and Ditto Branch. Additional rainfall amounts up to an inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rocky Mount... Sydnorsville... Penhook... Ferrum... Sontag... Western Smith Mountain Lake... Burnt Chimney... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
